humanum_full_description_en:
From " corpse ", the sound of " dagger " indicates stability and peace. Li Shi‧Hanshanyang Prefect Zhu Muhou Monument": "Jingjie Nikon."

" Nepal " may represent "nun," that nuns ministry said. Tang Hanyu "On the Buddha's Bone Table": "At the beginning of his ascension, he was not allowed to save people as monks, nuns, or Taoists, nor to establish temples."

" Ni " also refers to women who shave or become monks. "Xin Tang Shu-Dou Shen Biography": "Although Zhi complained, he was too heavy to kill. He was demoted to Sima in Huanzhou, and Jing Bo was in Quanzhou, and the nun was in Chenzhou, and he did not enter the maidservant."

" Ni " also means to stop and stop. "Order of Mozi‧": "Being upright, licentious, arrogant and not quiet, being a road nun, but afterwards, overtime and restlessness, it is sinful."

" Ni " can be used with " nick ", which means closeness and intimacy. "Shuowen": "From the back to it. From the corpse, the dagger sounds."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " corpse " and " dagger ", it means stability and peace.
humanum_full_description:
從「尸」，「匕」聲，表示安定、平和。隸釋‧漢山陽太守祝睦後碑》：「竟界尼康。」

　　「尼」可表示「尼姑」，即比丘尼的省稱。唐韓愈〈論佛骨表〉：「即位之初，即不許度人為僧、尼、道士，又不許創立寺觀。」

　　「尼」也指婦女披剃出家。《新唐書‧竇參傳》：「贄雖怨，然亦以殺之太重，乃貶驩州司馬，逐其息景伯於泉州，女尼于郴州，沒入貲產奴婢。」

　　「尼」還表示阻止、阻攔。《墨子‧號令》：「務色謾正，淫囂不靜，當路尼眾，舍事後就，踰時不寧，其罪射。」

　　「尼」可通「昵」，表示近、親昵。《說文》：「從後近之。从尸，匕聲。」
humanum_short_description: 從「尸」，「匕」聲，表示安定、平和。
